column4: I still have not upgraded  from dapper what are the advantages as i have only a mail server with minimal X
they informed me here to stick with dapper for server duties. i just did the install.
Dapper is LTS while Edgy is not.
it has a longer life cycle than Edgy - it will be officially supported longer.
its ok i guess but not as soild as sarge
never tried sarge. this machine has been powered on since the first ubuntu release and only rebooted for new kernels. i've never had any crashes.

i run a cuple of programs I used apt-get to install both need a pid file in /var/run but evertime i reboot it wipes the /var/run dir strange but on sarge its ok but had dapper now since brezzy but just thought I would give you my view
hmm.. strange. i've never had to muck around the /var directory much.
i think sarge and the new testing etch are more robust they are tested and tested again before release ubuntu is a rock for new people to linux
whats the apt-get for this missing library please libstdc++.so.5
